thread.title: Robertson family debuts clothing line, newspaper reports
thread.title_full: Robertson family debuts clothing line, newspaper reports | NOLA.com

author: Chelsea Brasted, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Robertson family debuts clothing line, newspaper reports
text:
From branded Band-Aids to licensing a musical and a museum exhibition , the Robertson family of "Duck Dynasty" fame has dipped its feathers into just about every possible market. The Robertsons, whose family and business making duck calls are featured on the A&E reality show, are now stepping down the runway into mainstream fashion, according to The Daily Advertiser.
The move is not unusual, given daughter Sadie Robertson's own line of "daddy approved" prom dresses with Sherri Hill or the Robertson matriarchs' partnership for branded Dooney & Bourke bags.
The newspaper reports that the family invited about 40 fans to a private unveiling at their home in Monroe, and images shared on social media show casual clothing items like plaid and camouflage shirts, denim and various accessories.
Click here to read the original story from The Daily Advertiser.
#commanderlife #duckcommander #dcsuperfan . We are loving the gifts from the Commander Life clothing line. Thanks! pic.twitter.com/jgG4XgFEJB
